availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George C. Castleman (Louisville merchant and Henry County farmer)

body.p: Kentucky steamboat captain, merchant/grocer, and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Jane C. Torbitt Castleman. Married to Mary J. Brinker Gist Castleman in 1859. Father of Samuel Castleman, Martha Castleman, David Castleman, and Josephine Castleman. Received a private school education. Clerk aboard the steamer Herold. Commander of the Gen. Wayne in 1835. Commander of the Robert Morris and the Ben Franklin. Captain of the Sherrod in 1837. Retired from the river life and returned to the family homestead in Woodford County, Kentucky. Engaged in the trading of cattle in Texas. Wholesale grocer in the company Castleman & Torbitt in Louisville, Kentucky from 1859 to 1861. Owned twelve enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Christian Church in Henry County.

ab.bibl:
